intro: Acinodendron lanceolatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf acinodendron, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The fruit is a small capsule that contains several seeds, facilitating its dispersal in natural habitats.
